title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
vmassol - (00:09): CalebJamesDeLisl: haven't you created a similar issue to this one: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-1325 ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:10): I didn't, let me look I think someone else did...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:11): XWIKI-4719  
vmassol - (00:12): thanks  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:12): No problem.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:16): Does it make sense to add translation keys to the core even if the registration page is going to be an application until translations can be imported without editing XWikiPreferences?  
vmassol - (00:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes, I think so even though I hate it :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:17): I will be sure to put some work in to getting importable translations because I hate it too.  
vmassol - (00:17): we really should fix this, it's not hard to fix (same solution as for wiki macros)  
vmassol - (00:17): but not in XE 2.2 timeframe. XE 2.3 maybe  
vmassol - (01:11): ok night time here... nn... see you tomorrow  
vmassol left at 01:14 (Client Quit  
sdumitriu left at 04:38 (Read error: 113 (No route to host)  
xwiki-bridge left at 05:04 (  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:30  
npm left at 09:33 ("Leaving."  
npm joined #xwiki at 09:38  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:40  
vmassol left at 09:48 (Client Quit  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:21  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:23): Hi Sergiu. Do you know how to add binaries to maven?  
sdumitriu - (11:25): Hi  
sdumitriu - (11:25): Yes  
sdumitriu - (11:25): Locally or to maven.xwiki.org?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:25): to maven.xwiki.org  
sdumitriu - (11:26): K, you need the proper rights for that  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:26): I have a couple of jcaptcha2.0 jars I need to add.  
sdumitriu - (11:26): Let me check if I still have them  
sdumitriu - (11:27): Yep, I have  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:27): Where should I put the files?  
sdumitriu - (11:27): Mail them to me  
sdumitriu - (11:28): If they hae  
sdumitriu - (11:29): If they have poms, mail to  
sdumitriu - (11:29): those too  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:32): I just sent them with the dependency calls, I'll mail the poms right now.  
sdumitriu - (11:36): Hm, the version is weird  
sdumitriu - (11:37): alpha-1 is already a version specifier  
sdumitriu - (11:37): And we can't have -SNAPSHOT dependencies during a release  
sdumitriu - (11:37): Did you build them, or got them from somewhere else?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:37): I built them.  
sdumitriu - (11:37): What svn version?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:38): revision 500  
sdumitriu - (11:39): K  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:39): Good call on the workspaces, it depends on 1.5.2, I guess that's a false alarm.  
sdumitriu - (11:40): WS is unmaintained anyway  
sdumitriu - (11:40): I don't think anybody is going to try to build it any time soon  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:41): I was going to fix the dependency when I hit the 403 wall :)  
sdumitriu - (11:43): Can you build the jars again with the version:  
sdumitriu - (11:43): 2.0-alpha-1-SNAPSHOT-500  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:43): Thanks.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:43): Oh wait, read too fast.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:43): How do I specify the version mvn command?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:51): I just put 500 in all of the version numbers and shut off the modules I don't need, we'll see what happens.  
sdumitriu - (12:05): Received them, I'll upload them now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:06): Thank you much.  
sdumitriu - (12:11): I need com.octo.captcha:jcaptcha-home too  
sdumitriu - (12:11): Should be just a pom  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:21): I just sent it.  
sdumitriu - (12:40): CalebJamesDeLisl: Done, try removing them from your local repo and build  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:42): Will do.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:54): It seemed to download okay, but since I purged the local repo, I will have to build the entire platform to have a definite answer.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:35): It works. Thanks.  
sdumitriu - (13:40): You're welcome  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 13:51  
tmortagne left at 13:52 (Client Quit  
lucaa left at 14:43 ("Leaving."  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:46): When I import the xar after wiping the database I'm not getting the statistics, "# $xwiki.package.installed.size() Document(s) installed" that instead.   
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:46): also in the log I see internal.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Left side ($list.size()) of '>' operation has null value at /templates/imported.vm[line 2, column 20]   
kibaho1 left #xwiki at 14:59  
kibaho1 joined #xwiki at 14:59  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 15:40  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:52): Hi Vincent.  
vmassol - (15:52): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:52): There seems to be some broken UI in the import xar template.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:53): When I import the xar after wiping the database I'm not getting the statistics, instead I get "# $xwiki.package.installed.size() Document(s) installed"   
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:53):  also in the log I see internal.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Left side ($list.size()) of '>' operation has null value at /templates/imported.vm[line 2, column 20]   
vmassol - (15:55): ok i'll test it too  
sdumitriu - (15:55): vmassol: You can edit comments now  
vmassol - (15:56): sdumitriu: yep seen your commit! nice. Will test it too :)  
sdumitriu - (15:56): Right now a user can edit only his comments  
vmassol - (15:58): sdumitriu: so an admin cannot yet edit other's comments?  
sdumitriu - (15:58): Only using the object editor  
vmassol - (15:58): ok  
sdumitriu - (15:58): It was intentional  
sdumitriu - (15:59): There are just two lines to change for admins to be able to edit, if this is decided  
vmassol - (16:10): ok  
SvenDowiu joined #xwiki at 16:35  
SvenDowideit left at 16:37 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)  
SvenDowiu is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:40): Should the registration app go in platform/applications? I had been thinking it would go in enterprise/wiki.  
sdumitriu - (16:40): Yes, enterprise  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:41): Ok.  
sdumitriu - (16:41): I don't think it's big enough to require its own application  
sdumitriu - (16:42): The alternative would be applications/administration  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:48): I don't think it's big enough either although it is much bigger than I had planned.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:49): One more question, which do you like better? "you are not allowed to use the characters....." or "Invalid entry"?  
sdumitriu - (16:54): First  
kibaho1 left #xwiki at 17:15  
vmassol - (17:25): CalebJamesDeLisl: it should go in platform  
vmassol - (17:25): IMO  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:25): Where in platform?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:26): Like with it's own jira issue and all?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:26): s/issue/project  
vmassol - (17:27): what does it do exactly?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:27): The same thing as the registration template but without using RegisterAction and with validation.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:28): And fields can easily be added.  
vmassol - (17:28): yes admin app is probbaly good for now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:28): Ok, I'll move the issue back to XWiki :)  
vmassol - (17:28): when it grows bigger or when we find a more generic domain we can move it  
vmassol - (17:29): CalebJamesDeLisl: it can be used with any product right? (not just XE)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:29): Yes.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:29): It makes sense that it should not be tied to XE, I just didn't know where to put it.

vmassol left at 18:20 (Client Quit

vmassol - (21:13): CalebJamesDeLisl: how do I activate the captcha on the registration page?
